metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8298 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The NVIDIA Linux Discrete GPU drivers before R304.125, R331.x before R331.113, R340.x before R340.65, R343.x before R343.36, and R346.x before R346.22, Linux for Tegra (L4T) driver before R21.2, and Chrome OS driver before R40 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and X server crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted GLX indirect rendering protocol request.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8298` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcuda1-304 - 304.125-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-304 - 304.125-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-current - 304.125-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-libopencl1-304 - 304.125-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-304 - 304.125-0ubuntu0.0.1
No subscription required

libcuda1-304-updates - 304.125-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-304-updates - 304.125-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-current-updates - 304.125-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-experimental-304 - 304.125-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-libopencl1-304-updates - 304.125-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-304-updates - 304.125-0ubuntu0.0.1
No subscription required

libcuda1-331 - 331.113-0ubuntu0.0.4
nvidia-319 - 331.113-0ubuntu0.0.4
nvidia-331 - 331.113-0ubuntu0.0.4
nvidia-331-uvm - 331.113-0ubuntu0.0.4

nvidia-opencl-icd-331 - 331.113-0ubuntu0.0.4
No subscription required

libcuda1-331-updates - 331.113-0ubuntu0.0.4
nvidia-319-updates - 331.113-0ubuntu0.0.4
nvidia-331-updates - 331.113-0ubuntu0.0.4
nvidia-331-updates-uvm - 331.113-0ubuntu0.0.4
nvidia-libopencl1-331-updates - 331.113-0ubuntu0.0.4
nvidia-opencl-icd-331-updates - 331.113-0ubuntu0.0.4
No subscription required
